name: Virginia A. BRIERLY v. Raymond F. BRIERLY, Jr.

parties: Virginia A. BRIERLY v. Raymond F. BRIERLY, Jr.

opinions.text:
ORDER
The petitioner’s motion to remand this case to the Family Court for hearing on a motion to adjudge respondent in contempt is granted. Upon conclusion of said hearing, this case shall be returned to this court forthwith.
DORIS, J., did not participate.

attorneys: Carolyn Roundey, Rhode Island Legal Services, Inc., Providence, for petitioner.
Raymond F. Brierly, Jr., pro se.
casebody.head_matter:
Virginia A. BRIERLY v. Raymond F. BRIERLY, Jr.
No. 79-483-A.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
March 27, 1980.
Carolyn Roundey, Rhode Island Legal Services, Inc., Providence, for petitioner.
Raymond F. Brierly, Jr., pro se.
